instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00923 - Grainy Display Even After Screen Replacement
threads.message:
Hello,

I have a MacBook A1706 EMC 3163 which had screen damage where there was a 2 inch vertical section of the screen that was completely black with a little bit of static / grainy screen which I haven't really noticed until a little later. Replacing the screen got rid of it, but what remains is a grainy display like the one shown in this link here: [URL]https://www.ifixit.com/Answers/View/639484/MacBook+Pro+2017+screen+flickering+-+glitching+-+has+horizontal+lines[/URL]


I can confirm that it is not a defective screen because I put the replacement screen on a known good working MacBook and the grainy screen disappears. I also tried one other replacement screen - same thing.

It is likely that there is issues on the motherboard itself. I have a LCD cable coming in to rule it out. Has anyone experienced this one before and solved it?

Thanks in advance.

threads.title: 820-00923 - Grainy Display Even After Screen Replacement
